perturbation.original_text: The appointment of the Agent hereunder shall terminate upon the earlier to occur of (a) forty-five (45) days after the last day of the Subscription and Community Offering, unless the Company and the Agent agree in writing to extend such period and the OTS agrees to extend the period of time in which the Securities may be sold, or (b) the receipt and acceptance of subscriptions and purchase orders for all of the Securities, or (c) the completion of the Syndicated Community Offering.
perturbation.changed_text: The appointment of the Agent hereunder shall terminate upon the earlier to occur of (a) ten (10) days after the last day of the Subscription and Community Offering, unless the Company and the Agent agree in writing to extend such period, or (b) the receipt and acceptance of subscriptions and purchase orders for all of the Securities, or (c) the completion of the Syndicated Community Offering.
perturbation.explanation: By reducing the termination period to 10 days, this modification may not provide adequate time as financial regulatory bodies and the OTS typically mandate longer durations for such activities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with regulations requiring reasonable timeframes for securities offerings, specifically requirements from the Office of Thrift Supervision (OTS) for this case.

perturbation.original_text: The Company will make generally available to its security holders as soon as practicable, but not later than 60 days after the close of the period covered thereby, an earnings statement covering a twelve month period beginning not later than the first day of the Company's fiscal quarter next following the effective date of the Registration Statement (as defined in Rule 158 of the Securities Act Regulations) that will satisfy the provisions of Section 11(a) of the Securities Act.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company will make available to its security holders an earnings statement covering a twelve month period at its discretion, but no later than 180 days after the fiscal year end.
perturbation.explanation: This change increases the timeframe for providing an earnings statement, potentially conflicting with SEC rules (e.g., 10-K filing deadlines) and regulations requiring timely financial disclosures, impacting investor rights and market transparency.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Conflicts with SEC regulations requiring timely filing of annual reports (10-K), such as timelines specified in the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

perturbation.original_text: Other than in connection with any employee benefit plan or arrangement described in the Prospectus, the Company will not, without the prior written consent of the Agent, sell or issue, contract to sell or otherwise dispose of, any shares of Common Stock other than the Securities for a period of 180 days following the Closing Time.
perturbation.changed_text: Other than in connection with any employee benefit plan or arrangement described in the Prospectus, the Company may sell or issue, contract to sell or otherwise dispose of, any shares of Common Stock other than the Securities at any time.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the lock-up period contradicts standard underwriting agreements and market practice, potentially violating securities laws related to stabilization and informed markets.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Violates standard securities regulations regarding lock-up agreements and restrictions on selling shares after an offering to prevent market manipulation.
